intro: Alseodaphnopsis ximengensis, commonly known as the Ximeng alseodaphnopsis, is a rare evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with dark green, glossy foliage. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
